data.message:
Hi Marshall, I know it sounds corny but you are my greatest motivation, in some sense an authority, even though I know that most people would support this. Your words speak to me When I'm angry, sad, embittered, frightened, powerless, but also cheerful, full of life and conscious of its value. I wanted to write you a letter but I know that and so you did not read it. I do not know if you move your white ass to read it, but there's always hope. Just want to thank you, know that every day I pray to God to bless you and your loved ones. He makes me want to howl in pain when I see your tired eyes and a sad face absent for more recent pictures. 
                Worst is the helplessness - I can not help you, though you so damn much you've done for me without even knowing my existence.
I am aware that for you it may be empty and worthless words, but although I'll try to get the answer. One question, one answer: your answer. 

Are you really happy?
